cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles west of Port Charlotte, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning north-northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana-Mississippi area) by late Monday and Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana/Mississippi border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Ocean Springs MS to the AL/FL border; Tropical Storm Watch Indian Pass to Ochlockonee River FL; Storm Surge Watch MS/AL border to AL/FL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Grand Isle LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas; Tropical Storm Warning east of Ocean Springs MS to Indian Pass FL; Storm Surge Warning Port Fourchon LA to the MS/AL border including Lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas, Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: eastern and north-central Gulf Coast from the Florida Panhandle westward to southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with a slight chance (≤3%) of tropical-storm-force winds; sustained gales unlikely
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of additional rainfall possible through Monday with isolated higher pockets; risk of urban/flash flooding is low
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip currents along Atlantic beaches may disrupt small-craft operations
